label: 免田
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: tax-exempt fields. Some researchers describe the increasingly patrimonial land tenure system of mid-Heian times—whereby clients of the powerful gained tax exemptions—as menden yoriudosei 免田寄人制 “cultivation of tax-exempt fields by dependents.”
